Package embedding

Class Embedder<T>

java.lang.Object
embedding.Embedder<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects to be embedded. The used Measure must also be applicable for this type.
Direct Known Subclasses:
DirectEmbedder, Isomap
public abstract class Embedder<T>
extends java.lang.Object
An Embedder to calculate coordinates for an array of certain objects.

Given an array of any type, an Embedder can be used to calculate coordinates in n-dimensional euclidean space that preserve some distance function between these objects as well as possible. For that a Measure for the type of objects must be given for construction. However, the distances to be preserved are not necessarily the direct distances given by the Measure. The definition of the distances to be preserved depends on the implementation of extending classes. It must not depend solely on the Measures distance but can also take into account the elements in the given array.

Once the distances between each of the given objects are determined, multidimensional scaling (MDS) is used to generate coordinates that preserve these distances as well as possible. To decrease computation, one can use LMDS (landmark MDS). For this slightly less accurate version of MDS only distances from the landmark points to the other points are required instead of the distances between all pairs of objects. The number of landmark points can be adjusted.

An Embedder can also be used to directly test the embedding quality.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier
See Also:
MultidimensionalScaling, CorrelationEvaluation

  • Field Details

    • MIN_DEFAULT_LANDMARKS

      public static final int MIN_DEFAULT_LANDMARKS
      Minimal landmark count an embedding will be assigned as default, given that the number of objects to be embedded is not less.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • elements

      protected T[] elements
      Elements to be embedded

    • measure

      protected Measure<T> measure
      Used to measure distances between the elements.

    • landmarks

      private int landmarks
      Number of landmarks to be used. Irrelevant as long as useLandmarks is false.

    • shuffle

      private final int[] shuffle
      LMDS needs random landmark points. Therefore the elements are saved in a shuffled order. To be able to unshuffle, a random permutation is generated and stored as array of indices.

    • useLandmarks

      private boolean useLandmarks
      Indicates whether to use MDS or LMDS.

  • Constructor Details

    • Embedder

      public Embedder​(T[] elements, Measure<T> measure)
      Constructs a new Embedder object using the given elements and Measure.

      No landmarks will be used by default. In case this is changed using useLandmarks(true) the landmark count defaults to the minimum of

      • the maximum of MIN_DEFAULT_LANDMARKS and elements.length
      • √elements.length
      Parameters:
      elements - the elements that are meant to be embedded
      measure - the measure used for the distance calculations
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null

    • Embedder

      public Embedder​(T[] elements, Measure<T> measure, int landmarks)
      Constructs a new Embedder object using the given elements, Measure and landmark count. Landmarks will be used by default
      Parameters:
      elements - the elements that are meant to be embedded
      measure - the measure used for the distance calculations
      landmarks - the number of landmark points
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null

  • Method Details

    • embed

      public double[][] embed​(int dimension)
      Calculates coordinates in n-dimensional euclidean space that preserve some distance function between these objects as well as possible. The definition of the distances to be preserved depends on the implementation of extending classes.

      The embedding will be returned so that

      embed(dimension)[i][j]
      is the jth coordinate of the ith embedding vector.
      Parameters:
      dimension - the dimension of the euclidean space the embedding is meant to use. The higher, the more accurate the embedding can be.
      Returns:
      the coordinates of the embedding. embed(dimension)[i][j] is the ith coordinate of the embedding of the jth element.

    • embeddingQuality

      public double embeddingQuality​(int dimension)
      Calculates the quality of the embedding in n-dimensional eucliden space.

      The residual variance of the following two matrices is used as the measure for the quality:

      • the distances returned by requiredDistances(int)
      • the euclidean distances within the embedding
      Parameters:
      dimension - the dimension of the eucliden space the embedding is meant to use. Generally, the higher the dimension, the better the quality
      Returns:
      the quality of the embedding as a value between 0 (perfect embedding) and 1 (no correlation between embedding and input distances)
      See Also:
      CorrelationEvaluation

    • getLandmarkCount

      public int getLandmarkCount()
      Returns the number of landmarks. If landmarks are not used at the moment, the saved count will be returned anyways.
      Returns:
      the number of landmarks used if useLandmarks was set to true

    • setLandmarkCount

      public void setLandmarkCount​(int landmarks)
      Used to set the number of landmarks used. If landmarks are not used at the moment, the landmark count is saved anyway and would be used after calling useLandmarks(false).
      Parameters:
      landmarks - the number of landmarks to use if useLandmarks was set to true
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given landmark count is greater than the number of elements or less than 0.

    • useLandmarks

      public void useLandmarks​(boolean useLandmarks)
      Enables or disables using landmarks. If enabling landmark usage, the last set landmark count is used. For default landmark count see Embedder(Object[], Measure).
      Parameters:
      useLandmarks - whether to use landmarks

    • requiredDistances

      protected abstract double[][] requiredDistances​(int startingPoints)
      Defines the distance between the starting points and all other elements that the embedding is supposed to preserve.

      The first entries of elements must be used as starting points. The returned distances must be positive. They also must be symmetric, meaning

      requiredDistances(startingPoints)[i][j]== requiredDistances(startingPoints)[j][i]
      provided that i,j<startingPoints.
      Parameters:
      startingPoints - the number of starting points
      Returns:
      the distances from starting points to all other entries. requiredDistances(startingPoints)[i][j] is the distance from the jth starting point to the ith element.

    • embedInternalOrder

      private double[][] embedInternalOrder​(int dimensions)
      Used to calculate the actual embedding used in embed(int). However, the returned embedding is sorted in the shuffled order.
      Parameters:
      dimensions - the dimension of the euclidean space the embedding is meant to use. The higher, the more accurate the embedding can be.
      Returns:
      the coordinates of the embedding. embed(dimension)[i][j] is the ith coordinate of the embedding of the jth element.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dimensions ≤ 0

    • getStartingPoints

      private int getStartingPoints()
      Returns the number of points that should be used as starting points (as in requiredDistances(int).

      This is simply the number of landmarks if those are used, the number of elements otherwise.

      Returns:
      the number of points that should be used as starting points

    • unshuffleEmbedding

      private double[][] unshuffleEmbedding​(double[][] embedding)
      Reverses the internally used index shuffling for an embedding. The given array will be changed.
      Parameters:
      embedding - the embedding that should be unshuffled
      Returns:
      the unshuffled embedding
